com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Class AbstractDataSet<T extends DataTable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.AbstractDataSet<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data table this data set holds.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataSet<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicDataSet

    public abstract class AbstractDataSet<T extends DataTable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataSet<T>

    The AbstractDataSet provides a skeletal implementation of DataSet which lowers the implementation bar for developers. It actually implements all methods in DataSet, adding a single abstract method for transferring input data tables to data tables of the type held by this data set.

    For implementation convenience, the data tables are held as objects in an internal map collection. In some instances (such as SqlDataSet), this object is not a convenient or correct way to hold and access the data tables; in such a case, the map can be set to null and the methods addTable(DataTable), dropTable(String), and getTable(String), which use the map, overridden to use whatever custom data structure is being used to hold/access the data tables.

    • Field Detail

      • tableLabelToSchema

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TableSchema> tableLabelToSchema
        Mapping from table label to table schema. Calls to addTable(DataTable), addTable(com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.metadata.TableSchema), and dropTable(String) should update this map appropriately.

      • tableLabelToTable

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T extends DataTable> tableLabelToTable
        Mapping from table label to actual data table. Used by addTable(DataTable), dropTable(String), and getTable(String). This object may be set to null if those methods are overridden to use some other custom data structure.

    • Method Detail

      • transferTable

        protected abstract T transferTable(DataTable table)
        Transfer a given data table to the type specified by this data set. This allows arbitrary data tables to be added to this data set.
        Parameters:
        table - The data table to be transferred.
        Returns:
        a copy of table transferred to this data set's table type.

      • addTable

        public DataTable addTable(DataTable table)
        Description copied from interface: DataSet
        Add a table to this data set. This will add the table in its entirety - both structure and data. This method may be unimplemented, but in that case DataSet.addTable(TableSchema) must be implemented. The input table need not be of the same type as that held by this data set; this method will make the necessary conversions, as needed.
        Specified by:
        addTable in interface DataSet<T extends DataTable>
        Parameters:
        table - The table to add to this data set.
        Returns:
        the new table, as it exists in the data set.

      • addTable

        public DataTable addTable(TableSchema schema)
        Description copied from interface: DataSet
        Add a table to this data set via a table schema definition. This will only add a table with the defined structure, data must be added using one of the various DataTable methods. This method may be unimplemented, but in that case DataSet.addTable(DataTable) must be implemented.
        Specified by:
        addTable in interface DataSet<T extends DataTable>
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema defining the table to add to this data set.
        Returns:
        the new table, as it exists in the data set.

      • verifySchemas

        public boolean verifySchemas()
        Description copied from interface: DataSet
        Verify the consistency of the table schemas in this data set. At a minimum, this should include checking that the schema is consistent with its table, and that the schema's other table references exists in the data set and are themselves consistent. Ideally, this method would also look into the data tables to ensure that the actual data relationships are also consistent (e.g. that a column which is keyed to another table's id column only contains number in the other tables id column).
        Specified by:
        verifySchemas in interface DataSet<T extends DataTable>
        Returns:
        true if the schemas are consistent, false othewise.
